title: Account takeover via phishing
scenario: User clicks phishing link -> creds captured -> attacker accesses cloud apps/data
vulnerability: Weak MFA coverage, user awareness gaps
actions: Enforce MFA for all; conditional access; phishing awareness; disable legacy auth

title: BEC / invoice fraud
scenario: Attacker spoofs supplier email -> finance pays fake invoice
actions: 2-person approval; out-of-band vendor bank change verification; DMARC rollout

title: Ransomware via remote access
scenario: Stolen creds or vuln on VPN/RDP -> lateral move -> encryption
actions: Patch/VPN hardening; MFA; restrict admin access; segmentation; EDR rollout

title: Backup compromise / no recovery
scenario: Ransomware deletes backups -> no restore
vulnerability: Backups not immutable, restore not tested
actions: Immutable/offline backups; separate creds; monthly restore test; backup monitoring
notes: Recovery is a control, not a hope

title: Privileged account misuse
scenario: Admin creds leaked -> full takeover
vulnerability: Shared admin accounts, no PAM, weak logging
actions: Unique admin accounts; PAM lite; just-in-time; audit logs; break-glass process

title: Data leakage via cloud sharing
scenario: Sensitive docs shared publicly by mistake
actions: Block external sharing by default; classification; DLP lite; periodic access review

title: Unpatched endpoints exploited
scenario: Malware exploits outdated software on laptops
actions: Patch SLA; auto-update; inventory; remove local admin; EDR

title: Lost/stolen laptop exposes data
scenario: Lost device exposes cached data
vulnerability: No full disk encryption, weak MDM
actions: BitLocker; MDM; remote wipe; conditional access for compliant devices

title: Supplier compromise impacts services
scenario: Vendor breach -> access to org data/services
vulnerability: No vendor security review, weak contracts
actions: Vendor questionnaire; contract clauses; access minimization; annual review

title: Insufficient logging & detection
scenario: Attack happens but not detected quickly
actions: Centralize logs; define top alerts; incident playbooks; quarterly tabletop

title: Weak incident response readiness
scenario: No clear roles/process -> slow containment
actions: IR plan; RACI; contact list; tabletop exercise; evidence preservation guide

title: Public portal vulnerability
scenario: Web vuln exploited -> data leak / defacement
actions: Basic SAST/DAST; patch cadence; WAF rules; vuln disclosure process

title: Weak password hygiene / no passwordless
scenario: Weak passwords/reuse -> credential stuffing -> account compromise
vulnerability: No password policy enforcement, no MFA everywhere
actions: Enforce MFA; password policy; block breached passwords; consider passwordless

title: Legacy authentication protocols enabled
scenario: Legacy auth (basic/IMAP) abused -> bypass controls
actions: Disable legacy auth; conditional access; monitor legacy sign-ins

title: DMARC not enforced
scenario: Spoofed domain emails sent to users/partners
actions: Implement DMARC (p=quarantine then reject); monitor reports

title: Sensitive data exposed via misconfigured sharing
scenario: Misconfigured permissions -> external access to sensitive docs
actions: Tighten sharing defaults; access reviews; DLP rules

title: Insider misuse of access to sensitive data
scenario: Authorized user exports HR/Finance data
vulnerability: No monitoring of bulk exports, weak least privilege
actions: Least privilege; logging of exports; alerts; periodic reviews

title: Shadow IT (unsanctioned SaaS) leads to data leakage
scenario: Users store data in unmanaged SaaS
actions: Approved SaaS list; awareness; block risky apps; CASB-lite if possible

title: Poor change management causes service outage
scenario: Bad change on network/VPN -> outage
actions: Change checklist; approvals for critical changes; rollback plan

title: Single point of failure on internet connectivity
scenario: ISP outage -> remote work / services unavailable
actions: Secondary ISP/4G backup; tested failover

title: Remote support tool abused by attacker
scenario: Attacker uses remote tool (vendor) to access systems
vulnerability: Vendor access too broad, weak MFA
actions: MFA; restrict vendor access; just-in-time; logging; review contracts

title: Unknown assets due to lack of inventory
scenario: Unmanaged devices/services remain unpatched
actions: Asset discovery; owner assignment; baseline + decommission unknowns

title: No vulnerability scanning / weak vuln management
scenario: Known vulns remain exploitable
actions: Monthly scanning; patch SLAs; track remediation

title: No structured awareness program
scenario: Users fall for common phishing/social engineering
vulnerability: No training, no simulations, unclear reporting
actions: Awareness program; reporting button; quarterly simulation

title: Flat network enables lateral movement
scenario: Compromised endpoint -> lateral move to servers
actions: Segment users/servers; restrict admin paths; block SMB where possible

title: Weak baseline hardening (CIS) on endpoints/servers
scenario: Misconfig exploited (macros, services, weak policies)
actions: Adopt baseline (CIS-lite); disable risky defaults; enforce policies

title: Secrets/API keys stored insecurely
scenario: Keys leaked from code/repos -> access to services
actions: Secrets vault; scanning for secrets; rotate keys; least privilege

title: Improper disposal of devices leaks data
scenario: Old disks/laptops not wiped -> data exposure
actions: Secure wipe procedure; certificates of destruction; vendor process

title: GDPR/PII mishandling leads to regulatory exposure
scenario: PII processed/stored without controls -> breach + sanctions
vulnerability: No DPIA, weak retention, unclear responsibilities
actions: Data mapping; retention; access controls; DPIA where needed

title: DDoS against public portal impacts availability
scenario: Attack saturates portal -> service outage
actions: Rate limiting; CDN/WAF; incident runbook; provider options
